result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Service for Protective Order, served to the defendant on 10/19/2022, filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Adjustment Number: 22A 040009,
Payable Number: 477721,
Receipt Number: 22R 043997,
Amount: $20.00
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/20/2022 received and filed.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/17/2022 received and filed.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/18/2022 - If the defendant fails to have the GPS installed tomorrow, a bench warrant will issue.**

The original document was titled: Proposed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 10-14-2022

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.

3:38 PM Defendant Bradford B Stops in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Bradford B Stops. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:26 PM Defendant Bradford B Stops not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. The Court received notice from the jail that the defendant is currently out of the facility. The Court will adjourn the initial appearance until tomorrow.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 12th, 2022.
Initial appearance on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:20 PM Defendant Bradford B Stops not in court, in custody at the Waukesha County Jail.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Bradford B Stops.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court was notified the defendant is currently out of the facility.  Court adjourns for initial appearance tomorrow.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
